title: Design-Make Studio-Based Mathematics Learning for Improving Engineering Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education emphasizing solving engineering problems encountered in real work environments through mathematical approaches for professionals

learning_goals: Learners can enhance their ability to translate real-world engineering problems into mathematical models
Learners can visually represent and improve problem-solving processes using the Design-Make-Share (DBS) methodology

Learners will form teams of three, derive two or more creative solutions for a given engineering problem (e.g., bridge design optimization) using collaboration tools (online whiteboards), and present solutions achieving 4+ points (on a 5-point scale) in two of three evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, cost-effectiveness).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
